alert.note: Alert for Coast Range of Northwest Oregon; North Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 09 at 2:57PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Oregon, including the following areas, Coast Range of Northwest Oregon and North Oregon Coast. * WHEN...Through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rain will remain heavy at times later this afternoon into Sunday morning. Rainfall from this afternoon into Sunday morning will be 1 to 3 inches of rain along the coast, with 3 to 6 inches across the Coast Range. Also of note is that Sunday`s high tide will be running 1 to 2 ft higher than it was earlier this week. This may exacerbate flooding for roads and communities near the mouths of coastal rivers. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Coast Range of Northwest Oregon; North Oregon Coast
